page.title: 06Housing; Upton Snodsbury.
page.content: One of the outstanding features of the area is the number of beautiful black and white timbered houses many of them thatched and dating from medieval times. Most of them have now been carefully modernised and are mainly lived in by the more wealthy commuters who have moved into the area,and can afford the high cost of maintenance of these properties. Many of them were formerly farmhouses or tied cottages lived in by agricultural workers,whose numbers have now greatly declined so their houses have been sold off by the land owners and townspeople buy them eagerly to convert into most desirable homes.There is a small modern council estate, including bungalows for the elderly. There are several private developments and some Victorian houses all of brick and tile construction.
